ygData.subject: Re: PoA bard quests plus a rant
ygData.msgSnippet: Heh of course I can assume the majority of people are gonna raise in level. Either way there are problems that need to be fixed even if the kmajority people
ygData.messageBody:
Heh of course I can assume the majority of people are gonna raise in level.
Either way there are problems that need to be fixed even if the kmajority
people aren't at such and such level. And right now the flat out truth of
the matteri s that overcrowding is at it's worse for high levels.

Naeeldar

-----Original Message-----
From: Perhaps a Princess... <sarah@...>
To: eqbards@onelist.com <eqbards@onelist.com>
Date: Monday, January 24, 2000 9:14 PM
Subject: RE: [eqbards] PoA bard quests plus a rant


>From: "Perhaps a Princess..." <sarah@...>
>
>*raised eyebrow* Assuming, of course, that there was not a horde of new
>accounts that opened right after Christmas I don't think you can assume
that
>the average has increased. Only Verant knows for sure.
>
>>-----Original Message-----
>>From: Naeeldar [mailto:jackal@...]
>>Sent: Monday, January 24, 2000 6:05 PM
>>To: eqbards@onelist.com
>>Subject: Re: [eqbards] PoA bard quests plus a rant
>>
>>
>>From: "Naeeldar" <jackal@...>
>>
>>Heh that was 2 months ago roughly I guess when he stated that the
majority
>>had a 30-40 level char. By now it's easily up to 35-45 probably higher. So
>>no your wrong and again their aren't problems at mid level you just want
>>something to be added for it for the hell of it we don't we want it to be
>>less crowded and able to hunt in zones.
>>
>>Naeeldar
>>
>>-----Original Message-----
>>From: RaceFace <bean@...>
>>To: eqbards@onelist.com <eqbards@onelist.com>
>>Date: Monday, January 24, 2000 9:00 PM
>>Subject: Re: [eqbards] PoA bard quests plus a rant
>>
>>
>>>From: "RaceFace" <bean@...>
>>>
>>>
>>>----- Original Message -----
>>>From: <jhenders@...>
>>>To: <eqbards@onelist.com>
>>>Sent: January 24, 2000 19:44
>>>Subject: Re: [eqbards] PoA bard quests plus a rant
>>>
>>>
>>>> From: jhenders@...
>>>>
>>>> Brad has already stated publicly that the majority of their customers
>>>> have mid level characters. He stated this when Paw was upgraded so you
>>>> can take his "mid level" as someone suitable to play Paw. As Brad has
>>>> direct access to the customer database, I think this provides a perfect
>>>> example of the uselessness of web polls. The only thing that poll tells
>>>> you is that 6% of the people who go to everlore and bothered to take
the
>>>> poll (and only voted once) have a 45+ character. I hope you can
>>>> understand the difference.
>>>
>>>Of course I can, that's why I said "if that poll is accurate." I hope
you
>>>can understand. :)
>>>
>>>Even going by Brad's statement, if the majority of people have
"mid-level"
>>>characters, they should get the majority of the attention, so the rest of
>>my
>>>statement still applies.
>>>
>>>
>>>
>>>
